availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dewitt Clinton Fry (Jacksonville, Morgan County, Illinois, constable.)

body.p: Jacksonville, Morgan County, Illinois, constable. New York native. Son of Charles Fry and Matilda Buck Fry. Married to Ermina Cobb Fry. Father of Frederick Fry, Hamilton Fry, D. C. Fry, Hattie Fry, Edward Fry, and Fannie Fry. Resident in Morgantown County, Illinois, in 1850. Constable in Morgan County in 1860. Constable in Morgan County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Morgan County, Jacksonville, p. 189A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Morgan County, Jacksonville, p. 333.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Morgan County, Jacksonville, Ward 2, p. 482B-483A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Morgan County, IL, June 1863, p. 131.
Frye GeneologyNorth America, Family Histories, 1500-2000_p. 82.
"Dewitt C. Fry (1825-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial 67034752, accessed April 7, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67034752.
